reviews.text: It's a wonderfully sneaky film that, before you know it, will have worked its way right under your skin.
reviews.author: Emma Simmonds

reviews.text: Fundamentally, Parasite aims to make us reflect on today's society, where the gap between the rich, the middle class and the poor is increasing.The spatial construction that the film proposes is a metaphor for the cruel social pyramid system.
reviews.author: Denise Pieniazek

reviews.text: Parasite is both darkly hilarious and delightfully shocking, setting a new sky-high standard for black comedy – the style of Bong Joon-ho.
reviews.author: Diana Tuova

reviews.text: “Parasite” does not put a foot wrong in either of its thematic or narrative capabilities. Via suspenseful drama, dark comedy, and an ingenious script and set design, the film offers commentary worthy of Ken Loach.
reviews.author: Calum Cooper

reviews.text: It’s a tricky balancing act, much like Bong’s abrupt shifts in tone, as Parasite is arguably the best film of the year at genre manipulation...
reviews.author: Brendan Cassidy

reviews.text: Parasite is the movie we will look back on as the movie of 2019. It crosses over to every culture because it’s simply about human beings struggling to survive in an unfair system.
reviews.author: Ryan McQuade

reviews.text: It is sadistic, angry and dark and has a lot to say about the system. This is the world we live in.
reviews.author: Jillian Chilingerian

reviews.text: "Parasite" has already made history for South Korea as the country's first film to win a Best Picture Academy Award. There are some moments I can't wrap my head around though, and one of them was the inclusion of Illinois State into the dialogue.
reviews.author: Jae-Ha Kim

reviews.text: Cinematography, score, editing… everything’s absolutely perfect. Nothing is placed without purpose. Not a single line of dialogue is wasted. It would be a shame if anyone fails to watch this magnificent movie just because it’s in a foreign language.
reviews.author: Manuel São Bento

reviews.text: Radically different films such as Knives Out, Us and Joker ... have all expressed the same social criticism. Parasite is perhaps the most pointed, explicitly showing how economic inequality brings out the worst in everyone, rich and poor alike.
reviews.author: Paul Kanieski

reviews.text: Bong Joon Ho’s many-sided, dark social satire is a cunning and resourceful commentary on South Korea’s economic inequality. Why it works is the relevance of that system across societies of every nation.
reviews.author: Mark Johnson

reviews.text: These tiny details underline the inherent horror, and concur with the genre-defying essence of the story...
reviews.author: Elle Haywood

reviews.text: Parasite will move you like nothing else.
reviews.author: Patricia Puentes

reviews.text: It is the last good thing that has happened since the shutdown...
reviews.author: Brian Susbielles

reviews.text: Visually stunning and searing satire...
reviews.author: Brian T. Carney

reviews.text: Incredible storytelling and examination of the class structure in Korea... Strong characterisation and performances create empathy from audiences, themselves becoming parasites to the film as host. Clinging on for dear life until the thrilling conclusion.
reviews.author: Dallas King

reviews.text: Delicate directing and immaculate production design make Parasite the masterpiece it is. Its social-study script belongs in a lab, as it comes with storytelling lessons that transcend language. Reason why it became universal. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Victor Pineyro

reviews.text: With a delicious black comedy edge, some surprising jolts of heartfelt emotion, and a violent throat punch when you’re least expecting it, “Parasite” is a movie that keeps you engaged and guessing.
reviews.author: Keith Garlington

reviews.text: Here is a dark comedy from the great Bong Joon-Ho about class warfare that, depending on your mood, you may find to be a work of genius or too self-indulgent. One thing is certain, you’ve never seen anything quite like it.
reviews.author: M.N. Miller

reviews.text: Bong Joon-ho's Parasite is a wryly detailed and superbly scripted portrait of contemporary class rage.
reviews.author: Rahul Desai

reviews.text: This is a filmmaker working at the top of his game, aided by brilliant satirical writing that feels as culturally relevant as it is emotionally resonant. It is a flawless knockout in every sense of the word.
reviews.author: Tom O'Brien

reviews.text: Though Bong calls Parasite a "tragicomedy" and layers the material with lively humor and his signature tonal playfulness, it's also his most furious and most fatalistic picture to date.
reviews.author: Brian Eggert

reviews.text: Bong Joon-ho has created something with Parasite thats darkly humorous, compelling, dramatic, poignant, and bittersweet all at the same time.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Harris

reviews.text: Episode 52: Jojo Rabbit / The Lighthouse / Parasite
reviews.author: Taylor Baker

reviews.text: A twist-laden narrative that effortlessly shapeshifts from comedy to drama to thriller with liquid ease.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Zhang

reviews.text: My respect for Bong Joon-Ho is up in the sky, because he and everyone else involved in this movie pretty much knocked it out of the park on multiple fronts.
reviews.author: Nicholas Oon

reviews.text: A bonkers, beautiful, radical, and drop-dead intelligent dark satirical tale of social inequality [and the] mock egalitarian weirdness of late capitalism.
reviews.author: Milana Vujkov

reviews.text: Like Ki-Jung, Park So-dam is the standout in a film filled with strong performances.
reviews.author: Carolyn Hinds

reviews.text: Parasite finds a way to be visually stunning, thematically resonant, horrifyingly tragic and fantastically gripping while fooling the audience into thinking they are having the time of their life.
reviews.author: Catherine Springer

reviews.text: It is such a clash of different genres and moods that it may as well be considered genreless, and yet it all somehow comes together in such a masterful way that you cannot help but leave the theater in a state of awe.
reviews.author: Nicolás Delgadillo

reviews.text: Parasite is a master class in storytelling, providing one of the finest examples of how to entertain the masses while still telling a deep and meaningful story.
reviews.author: Alex Bentley

reviews.text: I'll just come out and say it. Parasite is a masterpiece.
reviews.author: Rhys Bowen Jones

reviews.text: The film feels too insincere and hypocritical to take genuinely seriously on its theme of social injustice.
reviews.author: PJ Nabarro

reviews.text: Boon Joon Ho keeps us thoroughly enthralled as the story unfolds, deftly calibrating shifts in tone between satire, screwball farce, black comedy and horror, and also nimbly balancing our sympathies between the two families.
reviews.author: Jason Best

reviews.text: A splendid take on class inequalities that force the audience to question who is the parasite, the rich or the poor.
reviews.author: Wesley Lovell

reviews.text: Not content with a basic premise of crime and punishment, director Bong Joon Ho goes a step further, eventually corkscrewing off on a tangent that drags out the running time.
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: Precisely controlled and drolly ironic in tone even as its events grow more and more berserk, Parasite is always entertaining, foremost.
reviews.author: Dennis Harvey

reviews.text: Every actor brings different nuances to their respective portrayals and is completely in sync with the picture's seriocomic tone.
reviews.author: Matthew St. Clair

reviews.text: Bong's work was leading to this galvanizing movie which has really shocked people into further questioning the wealth gap and understanding the precariousness of the urban underclass in an era of climate change...
reviews.author: A.S. Hamrah

reviews.text: One of the best films of the decade and of Korean cinema (a nation that, by the way, has one of the most interesting filmographies of contemporary times). Its greatest strength is telling a story small but so powerful... [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Luis Bond

reviews.text: Bong's film is one which reveals itself in layers and it's almost impossible to categorise - it's at once a black comedy, thriller, horror, family drama and an allegory about class.
reviews.author: Niall Browne

reviews.text: An unusual director with his antenna attuned to social class...Bong has emerged over the past decade as a globally significant filmmaker.
reviews.author: Joanne Laurier

reviews.text: Parasite was the single best film I saw in 2019.
reviews.author: Scott Phillips

reviews.text: The most impressive part? That even though this is a crowd-pleaser, it somehow manages to be marvelously depressing in ways that don't hit until after the credits roll.
reviews.author: Matt Cipolla

reviews.text: It's important to go in as fresh as possible to enjoy the film's juicy surprises, which are unraveled with the craft of a master, steadily building characters into the scheme, inviting our complicity, then yanking out the rug.
reviews.author: Jason Fraley

reviews.text: What starts off as a light-hearted comedy ends up becoming a bloody thriller as Bong intertwines slapstick comedy scenes and tense artful schemes.
reviews.author: Prahlad Srihari

reviews.text: The fallout of socio-economic disparities that pit one class of people against another has rarely been put on the big screen with the kind of savage candour and devastating intensity that Bong brings.
reviews.author: Saibal Chatterjee

reviews.text: Bong Joon-ho masterfully sets the table, and then delivers a raw, brutal critique to society. A masterpiece and one of 2019 best films. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ricardo Gallegos

reviews.text: Parasite is a stunning achievement. It's a work that is as keenly prescient as it is superbly crafted.
reviews.author: Allen Almachar

reviews.text: I can say, without fear of being wrong, that this is one of the best movies of the year. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Yasser Medina

reviews.text: Parasite is a masterful piece of social satire and dark comedy, a scathing portrait of both the upper and lower classes.
reviews.author: Damond Fudge

reviews.text: In the movie's most vivid set piece, Bong demonstrates that water (to use a euphemism) rolls downhill: A downpour that is picturesque at the level of the mansion becomes a flood by the time it washes into the poor family's vulnerable neighborhood.
reviews.author: John Beifuss

reviews.text: Settling in for a narrative about a family trying to keep it together by overpowering the capitalistic battle, Bong Joon-ho has constructed a low-key tragic comedy that insists on being more than just that.
reviews.author: Shikhar Verma

reviews.text: PARASITE is Bong Joon Ho's masterpiece.
reviews.author: Sarah Musnicky

reviews.text: It's very rare a film makes a step-change in what is going on and the dynamics of the characters, and makes that work as well it does here.
reviews.author: Jim Ross

reviews.text: ...director Bong is also working on other levels, not only making all of its characters relatable - the Parks are really quite sweet people, if a little lacking in self-awareness - but telling his story with a healthy dose of uproarious slapstick.
reviews.author: Damon Wise

reviews.text: A picture that audaciously devours the force of convention and transforms it into a feverish undercurrent, driving what can only be described as an engine through the odyssey of mayhem.
reviews.author: David Keyes

reviews.text: Kudos go to Bong's sleight-of-hand narrative approach, as he seamlessly defying genres by alternating from drama to comedy to thriller and back again over the course of its 131-minute running time.
reviews.author: Casey Chong

reviews.text: Some satire but not at its best. And ugliness filled in the rest.
reviews.author: Betty Jo Tucker

reviews.text: A film that is genre-defying and free of the restraints of conventional storytelling.
reviews.author: Micheal Compton

reviews.text: With each passing day, Bong Joon-ho's class-conscious thriller about a family that lives in a sub-basement-and the blissfully naïve rich family they wind up working for-becomes even more prescient.
reviews.author: Laura Bradley

reviews.text: Get ready for thrills and laughter. As the credits roll, all the layers of meaning in every shot, character and object become clear and you can't wait to spread the word. This is what cinema does best -- entertain, provoke, create discussion.
reviews.author: Julia Swift

reviews.text: Everything is superbly controlled and nailed to the point at which you begin to question, how is this possible?
reviews.author: Ben Rolph

reviews.text: Parasite surprised me over and over. I constantly had no idea what was going to happen next. But what did happen, was amazing and extremely well done.
reviews.author: Tessa Smith

reviews.text: When the history of this moment in world cinema is written, Parasite will take its place as the movie that got the moment right.
reviews.author: Robert Koehler

reviews.text: A monumental achievement in film and the rare film that goes from "very good" to "historically great" in its final act.
reviews.author: Brian Gill

reviews.text: The smartest mainstream film about class made in many years, Bong Joon-ho's Parasite lays bare the lie that hard work can bring anyone closer to their dreams.
reviews.author: Dan Schindel

reviews.text: Never let the audience off the hook, Hitchcock once said. Ho achieves this in spades and with more than one hook.
reviews.author: Paul Farren

reviews.text: [A] funny, inventive, scary film.
reviews.author: Michael Wood

reviews.text: From his opening shots, Bong Joon-Ho establishes the upstairs/downstairs dynamic of his razorsharp, bleakly funny, unmistakably furious skewering of capitalism and class divides.
reviews.author: Roe McDermott

reviews.text: Bong hoped to give his film a classic sheen by creating a 'b&w' version. He needn't have done this: with or without color, Parasite will certainly be classic enough.
reviews.author: Ard Vijn

reviews.text: It is bracing, audacious, jarring, challenging and exciting, a devastating social satire realized with precision and intelligence in every perfectly constructed frame.
reviews.author: Asia Frey

reviews.text: It's a very good story.
reviews.author: Achara Kirk

reviews.text: The acting's amazing.
reviews.author: Jaby Koay

reviews.text: I think it's a career peak for [Bong Joon-ho].
reviews.author: Tim Robey

reviews.text: Watching that drama -- the bricks sort of build and then topple -- is so satisfying.
reviews.author: Simran Hans

reviews.text: Thinking very metaphorically may not lead to our salvation, but the consciousness it induces just might.
reviews.author: Rebecca Liu

reviews.text: Parasite provides a potential turning point for international films in America. Bong Joon-Ho's mystery drama will capture the hearts and minds of audiences worldwide
reviews.author: Sheraz Farooqi

reviews.text: The movie itself - message aside - is remarkably entertaining.
reviews.author: Jeremy Jahns

reviews.text: It conveys very clear messages about classism and discrimination, [all through] an entertaining and visually arresting story. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Sebastian Zavala Kahn

reviews.text: It's a splendid film, beautifully acted and realised, which manages to be both entertaining and profound.
reviews.author: Paul Whitington

reviews.text: A breath-taking cinematic accomplishment that will have you talking for days
reviews.author: Deirdre Molumby

reviews.text: [Bong Joon-ho]'s work is as playful as it is sincere and revelatory. He'll make you feel at home, and then rip the rug out from under you.
reviews.author: Clarisse Loughrey

reviews.text: This is what a true masterpiece looks like.
reviews.author: Linda Marric

reviews.text: Bong delivers a stunning return to form with this newest venture.
reviews.author: Ben Croll

reviews.text: What's to be said about this film that hasn't already been said? ... because there is so much to take in, like a Da Vinci painting, the film reveals secrets and hidden meanings until you're left breathless...
reviews.author: Sucharita Tyagi

reviews.text: Cinema of the highest form. No headline will ever convey the power of Parasite - it's a masterpiece that has to be seen to be believed.
reviews.author: Cameron Frew

reviews.text: What makes Parasite such a good film is that it tells a story first and foremost, so the social commentary whilst ever present isn't so overpowering that you cannot just enjoy the story being told.
reviews.author: Rosalynn Try-Hane

reviews.text: Ingeniously written and directed, plus faultlessly acted, this is one of the great movie experiences of this or any year.
reviews.author: Stephen Rebello

reviews.text: Despite the occasionally slow pace, an impressively strong finish means you'll enjoy finding out.
reviews.author: Matthew Bond

reviews.text: An impeccable script. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Juan José Beteta

reviews.text: Plugging into our universal disquiet about the inequality between the haves and have-nots, Bong has fashioned a darkly enjoyable class-war thriller in which the real monster is global capitalism itself, but there is nothing heady or didactic about it.
reviews.author: Tom Shone

reviews.text: One's left to wonder who's parasitically living off whom? The Kims off the Parks, or the Americans off their anti-communist allies?
reviews.author: Ed Whitfield

reviews.text: Parasite is a completely gripping and utterly entertaining masterpiece in which writer-director Bong Joon Ho has poured all his craft and vision into.
reviews.author: Nicola Austin

reviews.text: A tragicomic masterclass that will get under your skin and eat away at your cinematic soul.
reviews.author: Mark Kermode

reviews.text: This serpentine, unclassifiable piece stands as a highlight among the director's already glittering career.
reviews.author: Kevin Wight

reviews.text: Far from hiding, the film's beguiling charm stokes the deeply dystopian vision of its maker. In Bong's world, despite tokens like a cell phone or pizza dinners, social mobility doesn't quite exist.
reviews.author: Namrata Joshi

reviews.text: [I]ts delivery - mixing social satire, twisty plotting and Hitchcockian tension - a masterclass in serious-minded but accessible mainstream filmmaking.
reviews.author: Demetrios Matheou

reviews.text: [A]s a filmmaker [Bong's] less interested in finger-wagging admonishments than he is in taking us to uncomfortable places with outré plot twists that deepen and reframe what we think we know about the characters.
reviews.author: Alistair Harkness

reviews.text: Using industrial-strength social satire, [Bong Joon Ho] strips the veneer off the myth of classlessness, giving an outrageously entertaining instant classic.
reviews.author: Cath Clarke

reviews.text: While Parasite has won critical acclaim worldwide, seeming to strike a chord with audiences for its raw class commentary, the movie's message is not clear cut. It's a dark comedy, but by the end you're not sure if the joke is on you after all.
reviews.author: Jennifer Clark

reviews.text: It works on every level which is, perhaps, fitting for a film about levels and whether you are at the top or bottom in life.
reviews.author: Deborah Ross

reviews.text: Parasite is quite simply a supreme feat of film-making, a tense and hilarious jewel box of a film that draws you deeper and deeper into its wicked, absurdist satire.
reviews.author: Tom Duggins

reviews.text: Parasite works as entertainment and analysis, treat and treatise.
reviews.author: Ryan Gilbey

reviews.text: An imaginative comedy-thriller with darkness at its core.
reviews.author: Rafer Guzman

reviews.text: The word masterpiece is often too easily used... But you can easily understand why Parasite has been given that label by so many because finding a reason to disagree feels just as redundant.
reviews.author: Steven Sheehan

reviews.text: Though we largely root for the Kims, Bong doesn't allow anything as simple as rich versus poor, good versus bad. No wonder this movie speaks to global audiences - it's a parable about our capitalist world.
reviews.author: Larushka Ivan-Zadeh

reviews.text: A film that always has two thoughts in its head at once, a spectacular epic and tightly wound chamber piece, chicly sophisticated, brutal as a hammer.
reviews.author: Danny Leigh

reviews.text: extraordinary
reviews.author: Chris Hunneysett

reviews.text: It takes a while to get there, but it sticks its landing.
reviews.author: Richard Bonaduce

reviews.text: A miracle of a film. It feels like Bong Joon-ho's already extraordinary career has been building to this: a riotous social satire that's as gloriously entertaining as it is deeply sardonic.
reviews.author: John Nugent

reviews.text: Bong builds the rocambolesque plot of Parasite from a solid architectural skeleton. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Manu Yáñez

reviews.text: It's a gripping, existential, horrifying study of a nightmarish world - except that it is true.
reviews.author: Poulomi Das

reviews.text: We see what we want. We want what we see. Woe unto the collateral damage we leave. There may be no more original schemes, but the best movie of 2019 is more fascinated by original sins and the shapes they take in the here and now.
reviews.author: Nick Rogers

reviews.text: Intrigue, violence, gore and humor show us a Korea in which not everything that shines is gold. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fernando E. Juan Lima

reviews.text: Parasite is staggeringly good, a remarkable piece of filmmaking that immerses and unnerves. Bong Joon Ho's direction is that of a maestro, of an auteur unleashed.
reviews.author: Allen Adams

reviews.text: A masterful genre chronicle of savage injustice and a master-class in genre filmmaking from Bong Joon-ho, Parasite is a classic must-see for anyone who loves film.
reviews.author: Neal Pollack

reviews.text: Quite simply put, Parasite is a thrilling masterpiece from Bong Joon-ho, a director at the height of his powers offering a film that is profoundly entertaining, wonderfully realised, and thought-provoking.
reviews.author: Lewis Knight

reviews.text: In Parasite, Bong doesn't appear to be expressing empathy for the poor. Nor does he seem to be pointing fingers at the rich. He is, instead, questioning the very nature of mankind; its self-centred ingratitude and its propensity to create divisions.
reviews.author: Rohan Naahar

reviews.text: It really is a must-see.
reviews.author: Alexa Dalby

reviews.text: Very few movies in recent years have left you unsure what's going to happen next, but even when you do, it's still a compelling watch. Quite simply, Parasite is a masterpiece.
reviews.author: Ian Sandwell

reviews.text: Stunning and intricate, it is simply brilliant.
reviews.author: Katie Smith-Wong

reviews.text: A deep and complex narrative, rich in social commentary, is intricately wrapped within layer upon layer of different complementary genres and tones.
reviews.author: Kat Hughes

reviews.text: It plays like a brilliant con job comedy in the first half, before switching to total wacko mode at the end, with knives out and bloody. I liked the first half of this Jekyll and Hyde film a lot. The second half, not so much.
reviews.author: Robert Roten

reviews.text: Bong Joon-Ho here constructs a powerful and intense hybrid of genres, themes, and observations that grow and acquire sense as the story, which is full of rich details, unfolds. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Marcelo Stiletano

reviews.text: Humiliation is transformed into resentment and fantasy into reality. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Iván Belmont

reviews.text: Parasite is true to itself even when it stops being palatable.
reviews.author: Jorge Ignacio Castillo

reviews.text: As with his previous features such as Snowpiercer and The Host, Bong has created an intense drama laced throughout with scathing commentary.
reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: Bong Joon Ho has delivered one of the most well-assembled and compelling films of all time, which flawlessly navigates humor, despair, satire, and elements of thrilling horror to create an experience I won't soon forget.
reviews.author: Kent Garrison

reviews.text: "Parasite" flips through about ten different genres and takes the best bits of each; it feels like a relaxing buffet that expresses and sparks a love of cinema.
reviews.author: Rob Gonsalves

reviews.text: Parasite is a major accomplishment and a must-see film for anyone who loves cinema.
reviews.author: Mina Takla

reviews.text: Bong builds the smallest moments into something monumental.
reviews.author: Lapacazo Magrira Sandoval

reviews.text: No doubt Asian capitalist interests are well-served in the end, there won't be rioting in the streets on the back of this one. A film is hardly effective satire if it doesn't point up a route to radical change.
reviews.author: Paddy Kehoe

reviews.text: ... playful until it becomes diabolical... only then does (writer/director) Bong Joon Ho show exactly the cards he's holding.
reviews.author: Kevin A. Ranson

reviews.text: The only real question is how high you'll rank it in your top films of 2019 or the 2010s decade list.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Lyles

reviews.text: Unexpected, quirky, funny, horrific, dramatic - all of these things, but also just a bit tedious in parts. Not your average movie for sure.
reviews.author: Jackie K. Cooper

reviews.text: Somewhere, the ghost of Alfred Hitchcock is smiling with glee.
reviews.author: Don Shanahan

reviews.text: Parasite deserves to take its rightful place as one of the decade's finest films.
reviews.author: Michael Ward

reviews.text: Parasite is one of those beautiful rarities in cinema, a clever art-house title with much to say that is riotously entertaining and easily accessible.
reviews.author: Lou Thomas

reviews.text: We are facing a remarkable degree of narrative skill. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alejandro Alemán

reviews.text: Things get darker still... But Bong never lets the movie's dramatic tonal shifts derail the narrative momentum...
reviews.author: Randall King

reviews.text: A splendid movie. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Carlos Bonfil

reviews.text: A revolutionary film. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: William Venegas

reviews.text: Parasite makes us see a landscape of injustice that we normally don't want to see. It feels uncomfortable, but it offers us plenty of material for reflection. Bravo! [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Hugo Hernández Valdivia

reviews.text: Bong Joon-ho succeeds in showing us that the worst monster of our reality is the system that we have built. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Arturo Magaña

reviews.text: Bong is crude, direct, ruthless, and at the same time refined. The director doesn't deliver a moralizing discourse. On the contrary, he offers a crescendo where suspense and the grotesque come together. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Luis Fernando Galván

reviews.text: an elaborate thriller that at first seems to pit the have's against the have-not's, but is ultimately about how the have not's are forced to turn against each other in the mad clamor for whatever dwindling social and economic crumbs they can find
reviews.author: James Kendrick

reviews.text: We are before a remarkable degree of narrative skill. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alonso Díaz de la Vega

reviews.text: a parable about two families in Korea-one rich but dim, one poor but clever-and what happens when the poor household decides to scam the rich.
reviews.author: Sarah Boslaugh

reviews.text: Just when we think we know where the narrative is headed, Bong pulls the rug out from under us via turns that are occasionally dazzling, yet always organic, thanks to meticulous foreshadowing and his knack for slowly building an atmosphere of dread.
reviews.author: Phil Guie

reviews.text: Bong Joon-ho delivers something really special: the best film of 2019. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fico Cangiano

reviews.text: Parasite was too on the nose too often for me to give it my full heart. However, I loved an ambiguity at its core...
reviews.author: Rich Juzwiak

reviews.text: This is a mature, beautifully crafted piece of work and much cleverer than it initially appears.
reviews.author: Jennie Kermode

reviews.text: [A] fantastic film. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alberto Sáez Villarino

reviews.text: The conversation about the gap between social classes is cynical, fun, and exasperating, because Bong doesn't simply talks about rich versus poor, but things that few people dare to talk about. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jorge Rivera Rubio

reviews.text: I haven't seen another film that pinned down the essence of the year, wriggling and squirming, with such eviscerating precision. It's not just a film; it's a vivisection.
reviews.author: Dorothy Woodend

reviews.text: The only thing that you should expect is the unexpected.
reviews.author: Paul McGuire Grimes

reviews.text: This isn't just a killer picture on all of the standard levels, however. Contemplating society's growing class collisions and inequities, Parasite also makes a killer statement.
reviews.author: Sarah Ward

reviews.text: Parasite is cinema at its very best, and will continue to be lauded as a timeless masterpiece.
reviews.author: Wilson Kwong

reviews.text: It's the perfect mix of the director's penchants for tidy symbolism and unhinged tonal shifts, with a strong ensemble cast led by longtime Bong favorite Song Kang-ho.
reviews.author: Daniel Barnes

reviews.text: Parasite is a well-designed kick down the stairs that you cannot see coming. Rarely does a movie take you on the kind of trip this one does.
reviews.author: Frantz Jerome

reviews.text: If the movie is a Rorschach of who you identify as parasite and host, it's a test you're just as likely to fail; a filmgoing experience that refuses to fit into any box, and forces viewers to breathe the dangerous air outside of it too.
reviews.author: Leah Greenblatt

reviews.text: Let's just say that by "Parasite's" conclusion, what started out as a comedy of manners has become a furious snarl of rage and his most arresting social satire yet.
reviews.author: Bob Mondello

reviews.text: Obviously, these are not new themes or issues unheard of within the global economy, but it's not often a filmmaker finds a way to portray it in such unique shades of grey.
reviews.author: Gregory Ellwood

reviews.text: Even if its social message about culture and class (Alfred-Hitchcock-by-way-of-Karl-Marx) is laid on too thick in the end, this Parasite slithers most agreeably.
reviews.author: Nathaniel Bell

reviews.text: A very wild ride, and maybe Bong's best...
reviews.author: Kurt Loder

reviews.text: Bong Joon-ho has crafted one of the funniest comedies, most bristling class takedowns, creepiest thrillers, and contemplative films of the year.
reviews.author: Terence Johnson

reviews.text: Bong is an unfunny extremist. In Parasite, he annihilates the concept of the nuclear family by setting a brood of lower-class con artists against an upper-class family unit.
reviews.author: Armond White

reviews.text: Parasite may just be the most entertaining genre-bender of the year but more than this, the film brings a fascinating approach to class.
reviews.author: Danielle Solzman

reviews.text: What keeps you rapt in Parasite is the visual wit - every shot distills the movie's themes - and the richness of the characters and performances...
reviews.author: David Edelstein

reviews.text: Bong, in short, is a merchant of stealth.
reviews.author: Anthony Lane

reviews.text: This is the best movie I've seen this year. What begins as a clever social satire about the haves and have-nots in our world morphs into an ingenious (and violent) thriller with endless story twists.
reviews.author: Leonard Maltin

reviews.text: There may not be such a thing as a perfect film, but Parasite comes incredibly close.
reviews.author: Rob Dean

reviews.text: It's exhilarating, unexpected and, frankly, wild.
reviews.author: Anne Cohen

reviews.text: Imagine a high-wire act where the acrobat suddenly leaps to a higher wire, then to another that's higher still. It's the best way I can think of to describe the giddy thrill of watching Parasite, a masterpiece of serial surprises.
reviews.author: Joe Morgenstern

reviews.text: Nimble, funny, complex and heartbreaking, Parasite is a stinging indictment of economic inequality.
reviews.author: Thelma Adams

reviews.text: Bong's trademark slapstick is still here but the rough edges of his often too-loud lessons are shaved down nicely and his actors step forward
reviews.author: Mark Kennedy

reviews.text: An arthouse masterpiece, a strong contender for the best film of 2019.
reviews.author: Morgan Rojas

reviews.text: Maybe the best film Bong has yet made...
reviews.author: Dana Stevens

reviews.text: This is a dazzling work, gripping from beginning to end, full of big bangs and small wonders.
reviews.author: Dave Calhoun

reviews.text: In terms of sheer enjoyment alone, Parasite delivers. The movie is as darkly funny as its director, and even with a runtime just on the far side of two hours, it never loses its momentum.
reviews.author: Jeva Lange

reviews.text: A light farce that gradually transforms into an urgent class parable, getting exponentially more compelling moment by moment. Possibly Bong's best, and certainly one of the best of the year.
reviews.author: Vincent Mancini

reviews.text: All the viewer knows is that Bong is telling a story about humans, which means it can be a perfect comedy until it becomes a tragedy.
reviews.author: David Sims

reviews.text: As I left the theater, the first words that were uttered under my breath was, "Oh, so this is what Cinema feels like?"
reviews.author: Rendy Jones

reviews.text: Bong has some ideas in "Parasite," but the movie's greatness isn't a matter of his apparent ethics or ethos... but of how he delivers truths, often perversely and without an iota of self-serving cant.
reviews.author: Manohla Dargis

reviews.text: This is a uniquely entertaining movie --- one that you can't stop thinking about long after leaving the theater.
reviews.author: Jeanne Kaplan

reviews.text: The ever-suspenseful PARASITE keeps us guessing throughout. ..one of 2019's best-conceived movies.
reviews.author: David Kaplan

reviews.text: It tells a story you could probably follow without subtitles, or any dialogue at all: the faces of these actors show with piercing clarity how it feels to be outsiders in a world of wealth and privilege.
reviews.author: Stephanie Zacharek

reviews.text: Cinematic perfection doesn't come around often. When it does, it's essential to take notice. "Parasite," from top to bottom, is a perfect film.
reviews.author: Joey Magidson

reviews.text: [Parasite] is a crazy, intense, twisted, and dark movie.
reviews.author: John Nguyen

reviews.text: "Parasite" is Bong's most sophisticated film to date, expertly plotted with breathtaking reveals, and shot with a smooth, slippery sheen, each frame and camera movement communicating a subconscious plot twist or theme.
reviews.author: Katie Walsh

reviews.text: Let's just say it: the South Korean auteur Bong Joon Ho is some kind of genius and he tops himself with 'Parasite'-it's explosive filmmaking on every level and one of the cinema high points of 2019 . You won't know what hit you.
reviews.author: Peter Travers

reviews.text: Class warfare among two South Korean families is treated with both comedy and horror in Bong's latest picture.
reviews.author: Harvey S. Karten

reviews.text: Bong Joon Ho's Cannes Film Festival winner is a flat out masterpiece.
reviews.author: Pete Hammond

reviews.text: Brilliantly crafted film delving full on into social class, racism within the race with a delicious twist in the final act make Parasite a must-see!
reviews.author: Carla Renata

reviews.text: Parasite is loaded with good performances and memorable characters that go from anecdotal to social radiography. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fausto Ponce

reviews.text: "Parasite" attaches to you and doesn't let go.
reviews.author: Brian Truitt

reviews.text: Parasite is a real gem
reviews.author: Aaron Neuwirth

reviews.text: Parasite navigates human morality in an interesting way that is not dissimilar to Patricia Highsmith's stories.
reviews.author: Juan Barquin

reviews.text: If anything, Parasite is a condemnation of choosing to ignore the inconvenient suffering of your fellow human beings, presented in a seres of accomplished visual metaphors that'll make you rethink all sorts of ordinary household objects.
reviews.author: Katie Rife

reviews.text: Best Movie of 2019; Parasite has a unique creative story, characters that feel real, and an underlying message about high and low classes, conveyed thrillingly.
reviews.author: Jason Escamilla

reviews.text: How Bong gets me to gasp, shriek, and laugh within the span of seconds is beyond me. It's a film that you would want to rewatch the second it's over.
reviews.author: Kevin L. Lee

reviews.text: Bong Joon-ho, who has consistently played with what the class system means in a modern day South Korea, has finally reached his pinnacle with his latest film, Parasite.
reviews.author: Jenny Nulf

reviews.text: At the core of this film is an us-vs-them solidarity that makes even its most contrived narrative payoffs reverberate with emotional authenticity.
reviews.author: Andrew Chan

reviews.text: Parasite is, in fact, a stunning work from one of the cinema's most reliable masters, and it's a film best seen with virgin eyes and ears, knowing as little as possible about its plot, themes or characters.
reviews.author: Nick Johnston

reviews.text: Far from being melodramatically schematic, it leaves some ambiguity around the edges, raising questions it doesn't necessarily claim to be able to answer.
reviews.author: Kyle Smith

reviews.text: By turns hilarious, harrowing, and horrifying, Parasite may well be Bong Joon-ho's best film since Memories of Murder.
reviews.author: Lauren Humphries-Brooks

reviews.text: A tragedy of epic proportions that should scheme, con, and scam its way into many "best of" lists by the end of the year.
reviews.author: Rafael Motamayor

reviews.text: This is a darkly amusing masterwork about the never-ending tale of two cities. All in one.
reviews.author: David Crow

reviews.text: Another fantastically outrageous and weird film ... that continues to show the glory of [Korean] cinema and Director Bong as its master.
reviews.author: Edward Douglas

reviews.text: Bong Joon-ho's Parasite is a masterpiece, and essential viewing for our times.
reviews.author: Alan Cerny

reviews.text: [A] stylish, exquisite knife to the heart of capitalism's cruelties.
reviews.author: Eric Webb

reviews.text: What Bong presents with "Parasite" is a scenario provoking the imaginary. The bottom line could well be just the wild wide of pure entertainment.
reviews.author: Diana Cheng

reviews.text: It's another of Bong's brilliant but hard to label movies.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: The work of a... true filmmaker. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jonay Armas

reviews.text: Parasite is one of the best films you'll see this year, and certainly the most insane.
reviews.author: Sarah Marrs

reviews.text: Parasite's horror lingers in the memory, for sure, but it's the intricately crafted and universal social commentary that truly resonates in our modern times.
reviews.author: Tom Beasley

reviews.text: Bong Joon-ho's pitch-black comedy Parasite might his masterpiece.
reviews.author: Kristy Puchko

reviews.text: Not being openly fantastical, Parasite first engages us in a basement that could be part of any science fiction movie.[Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Erick Estrada

reviews.text: Parasite conjures up images of a creature which takes from a victimized host without a thought of giving or the consequences thereof, but as Joon-ho Bong's latest bit of brilliance unfolds, it's unclear just whom is feeding on whom.
reviews.author: Andrea Thompson

reviews.text: An exhilarating rollercoaster ride that keeps you guessing at every sharp turn, and by the end, leaves you a bit paralyzed by its magnificence.
reviews.author: Oliver Whitney

reviews.text: A masterpiece in storytelling. Parasite is a dark, twisted and unexpected fable about social injustice. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Rene Sanchez

reviews.text: While it's hugely entertaining, Parasite is also thought-provoking. By the time the catharsis arrives, you think you're at the end of the film, but a coda adds a new wrinkle to the whole thing.
reviews.author: Alissa Wilkinson

reviews.text: Parasite is many things rolled into one: a sharply observed satire, black comedy, thriller, tragedy.
reviews.author: Shubhra Gupta

reviews.text: One of those cases where it's easy to use the qualifier "masterpiece". [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Emmanuel Báez

reviews.text: What Parasite does best is highlight the symbiotic relationship between the rich and the poor. Joon-ho has constantly shown the contrast between the social classes in his work, but Parasite takes the commentary a step further.
reviews.author: Adriana Gomez-Weston

reviews.text: Parasite... is a clever, dark comedy and social commentary about the invisible working poor who will do anything to survive.
reviews.author: Sr. Rose Pacatte

reviews.text: Satire morphs into a savage underclass morality lesson that recalls the home invasion tales of Michael Haneke and Jordan Peele.
reviews.author: Peter Howell

reviews.text: There's no way to predict Parasite, one of those few movies that reinvent themselves at every corner. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Orlando Maldonado

reviews.text: Parasite inveigles its way into our consciousness. We laugh, at first, at its skewing of reality and the sheer temerity of its main characters. But laughter soon gives way to fright and then to despair.
reviews.author: Andrew Kendall

reviews.text: Parasite goes from Shoplifters to Get Out to Sorry to Bother You in a breakneck way so unsettling you don't notice it happening.
reviews.author: Walter Chaw

reviews.text: Joon-ho's assured direction, partnered with his passionate and mesmerizing ensemble, "Parasite" emerges as one of the year's most vital and entertaining pieces of filmmaking, perhaps one of the most lively to bookend the decade.
reviews.author: Clayton Davis

reviews.text: Joon-ho's film straddles multiple genres, with comedy rubbing shoulders alongside drama, thriller, and eventually horror to tell a story that's as entertaining as it is socially incendiary.
reviews.author: Chris Tilly

reviews.text: It's a hell of a ride - and one of the year's best films.
reviews.author: Norman Wilner

reviews.text: All and all, this is a film with a razor-sharp edge. It's angry, it's joyous, and - to keep it simple - it's a ton of fun.
reviews.author: James Clay

reviews.text: Parasite likely works better as a discovery film or severely managed expectations rather than something that's guaranteed to blow audiences away.
reviews.author: Dustin Chase

reviews.text: Delicious social satire from a master of the genre.
reviews.author: Chris Bumbray

reviews.text: Parasite is unquestionably one of the best films of the year.
reviews.author: Brian Tallerico

reviews.text: An exhilarating and furious indictment of class struggle, Parasite might be the masterpiece South Korea's Bong Joon-ho has been working toward his entire career.
reviews.author: Barry Hertz

reviews.text: There are at least three perfectly good films squeezed into Parasite's 131 minutes. The way Bong Joon-ho weaves them together, without ever slipping into self-indulgence or excess, is nothing short of masterful.
reviews.author: Sarah Kurchak

reviews.text: The speed and ferocity with which things fall apart-and with which Parasite mutates from a sly upstairs-downstairs satire into something more literally and tonally multileveled-is something to behold.
reviews.author: Adam Nayman

reviews.text: The success of Parasite is not merely marked by great filmmaking and an intriguing storyline, but deep within its foundations lies an overwhelming understanding on Bong's part of how bigotry operates at an almost molecular level.
reviews.author: Alexandra Heller-Nicholas

reviews.text: Effortlessly mixing genres, Parasite is a brilliant work that emphasizes that the stairway to financial freedom is rarely accessible to those who need it the most.
reviews.author: Courtney Small

reviews.text: A brilliant, biting, chilling, and darkly hilarious bit of social commentary from Korean master filmmaker Bong Joon-ho that's as entertaining as it is unsettling.
reviews.author: Andrew Parker

reviews.text: A scathing social satire that fuses raucous comedy with deep despair...
reviews.author: Amy Taubin

reviews.text: A dark, deeply funny, searingly relevant tale which will remain embedded in my subconscious for my lifetime.
reviews.author: Kate Rodger

reviews.text: Parasite offers a lot of wicked pleasures, providing you with a delightfully insane cinematic experience. This is pretty strong filmmaking admittedly and one of the best films of the year in its genre.
reviews.author: Filipe Freitas

reviews.text: The journey from the first scene to the end is perhaps the most intricate, most scathing, and surprisingly most accessible portrayal of class struggle put into film.
reviews.author: Oggs Cruz

reviews.text: I certainly won't give away any spoilers here, but suffice it to say that you won't guess any of the secrets, and once the story goes down the rabbit hole, it stays very dark till the end.
reviews.author: Hannah Brown

reviews.text: Parasite is weird, funny and unforgettable.
reviews.author: Matthew Toomey

reviews.text: Bong uses everything in his bag of cinematic tricks to craft a dazzling and devastating movie that is part modern-day parable and part family drama. Parasite will variously shock you, make you laugh (guiltily) and make you think.
reviews.author: Wenlei Ma

reviews.text: Twists and turns aside, this surprise comes more from Parasite's very make-up: the formal strategies, tonal malleability, and sheer density of the film's intricate construction.
reviews.author: Adam Cook

reviews.text: Parasite is Bong Joon-ho at his very best. A masterpiece of storytelling and a captivating dissection of class struggles, it is cinema at its finest.
reviews.author: Jonathan Barkan

reviews.text: Parasite is director Bong in top form; a sadistically funny and dramatically sound cinematic experience that is sure to shock, provoke and linger due to its wonderful performances, audacious storytelling, pitch-black humour and incisive social critique.
reviews.author: Harris Dang

reviews.text: It is surprising, humorous, completely disturbing, and a thoroughly entertaining addition to this golden age of Asian cinema.
reviews.author: Damien Straker

reviews.text: While Ki-taek's family toast their good fortune, catastrophe lies just around the corner. For the Parks, the fairy-tale of their lives proves too good to be true.
reviews.author: John McDonald

reviews.text: Bong has crafted a modern classic... a gripping, frequently funny and often nerve-wracking film...
reviews.author: Steve Newall

reviews.text: Parasite is a subversive delight, and despite its hefty 2 1/4-hour running time is never dull because Bong keeps shifting the goalposts...
reviews.author: David Stratton

reviews.text: Just when you think you have a handle on Joon-ho's film, however, and you mistakenly assume you know why this is called Parasite, it takes a turn though, and becomes an even richer and more profound study.
reviews.author: David 'Mad Dog' Bradley

reviews.text: Devotees of world cinema should make tracks for this right away.
reviews.author: Leigh Paatsch

reviews.text: Out of work like the rest of his hard-up South Korean family, Ki-woo has his world seriously rocked when he scams a job with the loaded Park family.
reviews.author: Andiee Paviour

reviews.text: Social satires rarely come as funny, unpredictable or as generous to its characters as this.
reviews.author: John Lui

reviews.text: It's a rollickingly, grim dispatch from a society chowing down on its own entrails, where the underclass are clawing at each other, the rich get twisted up by their own malaise, and everyone's losing their goddamn minds.
reviews.author: Luke Goodsell

reviews.text: Funny, real, gritty and well-supported by a solid cast, the Palme d'Or winner at this year's Cannes Film Festival is a breath of fresh air after the onslaught of Hollywood blockbusters.
reviews.author: Joanne Soh

reviews.text: A ripping good yarn.
reviews.author: Vicky Roach

reviews.text: Parasite benefits from crisp, rich cinematography, a deep back-bench of brilliant performers, and a script of clockwork-like precision.
reviews.author: Tom Augustine

reviews.text: The inspired Parasite can't precisely be labelled a comedy, a thriller, nor a socially conscious drama about the class divide in South Korea, although it contains elements of all three.
reviews.author: Jake Wilson

reviews.text: Parasite is a masterclass in writing and narrative control.
reviews.author: Graeme Tuckett

reviews.text: Extremely well crafted and scripted ... Fun, propulsive, ingenious and quite loveable.
reviews.author: CJ Johnson

reviews.text: It's a weird but maybe era-appropriate coincidence that the two best films of the year so far-Us and now Parasite-are searing black comedies about class, featuring two rival families whose differences in wealth are largely the result of chance.
reviews.author: Simon Miraudo

reviews.text: Coming away from this film will leave you with empathy for those less privileged, and yet the film toys with the idea that even if you do fake your way to the top, you still may ultimately end up back in the basement.
reviews.author: Jennifer Bisset

reviews.text: Survivalism ain't pretty, but then that's why all the characters in Parasite rich and poor alike have to dress it up as something more noble.
reviews.author: William Schwartz

reviews.text: A masterful portrait of inequality and imbalance, 'Parasite' latches on and never once lets go.
reviews.author: Doug Jamieson

reviews.text: ...the work of a director intoxicatingly in his element.
reviews.author: Andrew Blackie

reviews.text: This dark, dark comedy straddles several genres and is very satisfying.
reviews.author: Lisa Nesselson

reviews.text: The hilariously inventive story has so many unexpected moments of out-there mayhem that it's hard to keep count. And the ways in which Bong turns the screws on the clan of grifters is absolutely riveting.
reviews.author: Stephen Garrett

reviews.text: A riveting and hilarious look at the serious subject of class inequality. Immensely fun and beautifully made.
reviews.author: Jo-Ann Titmarsh

reviews.text: Parasite puts a wickedly literal spin on the notion that there is always someone lower on the socioeconomic ladder.
reviews.author: Dennis Lim

reviews.text: It may seem far-fetched and absurd, but when you think about it, it is freakishly grounded in reality. This makes it not only the director's story, but each viewer's story as well.
reviews.author: Min-sik Yoon

reviews.text: A film so full of provocative and stimulating ideas that each of its twists could be a new movie. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Juanma Ruiz

reviews.text: Only a creator as free and as original as Bong Joon-ho can succed in turning out an adventure so unorthodox and as stimulating, as unpredictable and as devastating as Parasite. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Carlos F. Heredero

reviews.text: An excellent film about the 'others'. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Àngel Quintana

reviews.text: A work with impeccable narrative rigor. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jorge (JJ) Negrete

reviews.text: Parasite is a complex, thrilling and audacious social satire, and an instant contender for film of the year.
reviews.author: Tom Bond

reviews.text: Parasite flits between dark comedy, thriller, horror and farce with such ease that the boundaries become indistinguishable.
reviews.author: Iana Murray

reviews.text: Bong is very happy to indulge in farcical satire and by the midpoint of his movie, it seems that we're settling in for a modern take on the contrasts between two players in the class struggle.
reviews.author: Luiz Oliveira

reviews.text: The film has a power, a vertigo, a virtuosity, a disgrace and an uncomfortable picardy that make the Korean filmmaker one of the most impious observers of the deep inequalities that wild capitalism generates. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Diego Batlle

reviews.text: It is exciting to see Bong Joon Ho's facility to pass the most devastating messages about the world that we tread almost without being noticed. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Luis Martínez

reviews.text: 'Parasite' is all I can ask of a film. Surprising, hilarious, exciting and, above all, a masterful lesson in staging. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Luis Caviaro

reviews.text: You expect the whole enterprise to come crashing down around his ears, but this is a film-maker in total control of his craft.
reviews.author: Ed Potton

reviews.text: As the third act grinds to a grim conclusion, the yawning social divisions cause the laughter to curdle into unease. It's an extraordinary performance.
reviews.author: Donald Clarke

reviews.text: The social commentary is almost as powerful as the plot itself.
reviews.author: Emma Jones

reviews.text: Be prepared to burst into compulsive applause throughout the movie as holding in your excitement will feel unthinkable.
reviews.author: Luke Hicks

reviews.text: The director's fiercely intelligent voice is unmistakable in Parasite, but the playfulness keeps an audience irretrievably invested.
reviews.author: Ella Kemp

reviews.text: Parasite is a vital, extraordinary slice of blood-boiling entertainment, surveying human ambition to piece together exactly why a class system is failing an entire country.
reviews.author: Gus Edgar

reviews.text: To say more about Parasite and spoil its secrets would be to ruin the fun, but rest assured, as Bong's class satire is one of his finest films to date.
reviews.author: Alistair Ryder

reviews.text: A brilliantly written satirical-suspense comedy. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ruben Peralta Rigaud

reviews.text: There are other similarities with his twisted 2013 sci-fi. Joon-Ho's use of contained spaces once again allows the director to navigate his subject matter very effectively.
reviews.author: Joseph Walsh

reviews.text: Shifts tonal gears in total service of its class politics, infecting the film's breezy dark-comedy with notes of rage and melancholy.
reviews.author: A.A. Dowd

reviews.text: "Parasite" begins in exhilaration and ends in devastation, but the triumph of the movie is that it fully lives and breathes at every moment, even when you might find yourself struggling to exhale.
reviews.author: Justin Chang

reviews.text: It grips from first frame to last.
reviews.author: Jamie Graham

reviews.text: You'd be hard-put to find anything with the acerbic brilliance of Bong Joon-ho's Parasite, a masterful dissection of social inequality and the psychology of money.
reviews.author: John Bleasdale

reviews.text: To say much more would be to give away too many delicious surprises, but the film unfolds like a warped blend of Jordan's Peele's Us and Hirokazu Kore-eda's Shoplifters in its blazingly brutal, smart and heartfelt messaging.
reviews.author: Katherine McLaughlin

reviews.text: Ever the sui generis genre-switcher, Bong this time has his class struggle play out in a con-family comedy. And it's a riot.
reviews.author: Isabel Stevens

reviews.text: Melts Buñuel with Hitchcock. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Daniel de Partearroyo

reviews.text: The impotent rage he feels about that spills into every frame of this incredible film, and leaves us all a little richer as a result.
reviews.author: David Ehrlich

reviews.text: A wonder of an allegory.
reviews.author: Richard Lawson

reviews.text: A demented and often-uproarious class-conscious satire, "Parasite" falls slightly short of Bong's greatest work.
reviews.author: Bradley Warren

reviews.text: Imagine the premise and empathy of Hirokazu Koreeda's Shoplifters, but with the genre-defying tone and brash ambition of Jordan Peele's Us. Such is Parasite, a work of maniacal cinematic genius.
reviews.author: Joel Mayward

reviews.text: [Parasite is] transcending dramatic comedy, and even social satire. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Clarín Staff

reviews.text: There is absolutely nothing subtle about Bong Joon-ho's "Parasite." It feels like Kore-eda on steroids.
reviews.author: Jordan Ruimy

reviews.text: Despite wearing its central conspicuous messages blatantly on its sleeve, this is another piquant pleasure from Joon-ho -- a hostile dramedy with something new to say about families who stay together.
reviews.author: Nicholas Bell

reviews.text: A nerve-racking masterpiece whose spell lingers long after its haunting final image.
reviews.author: Bilge Ebiri

reviews.text: Pivoting from hysteria to grotesque on a moment's notice, it's a bloodthirsty farce.
reviews.author: Hannah Strong

reviews.text: Parasite is bravura filmmaking at its finest. Heavenly.
reviews.author: James Mottram

reviews.text: Bong is back and on brilliant form, but he is unmistakably, roaringly furious, and it registers because the target is so deserving, so enormous, so 2019: "Parasite" is a tick fat with the bitter blood of class rage.
reviews.author: Jessica Kiang

reviews.text: It's a film that burrows under your skin and sinks in its teeth.
reviews.author: Robbie Collin

reviews.text: Parasite gets its tendrils into you.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: Parasite is generally gripping and finely crafted, standing up well as Bong's most mature state-of-the-nation statement since Memories of Murder in 2003.
reviews.author: Stephen Dalton

reviews.text: A vigorous and tightly controlled comedy that sees [Bong] back on top form, with a story that's both rigorously achieved and very specifically Korean.
reviews.author: Jonathan Romney

synopsis: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.
